alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Stokes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 7:36PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Increasing Flood Threat from Excessive Rainfall Across Eastern Stokes and Western Rockingham Counties through 1045 PM EDT... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including the following counties, Rockingham and Stokes. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly within the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is possible during the next 1 to 2 hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Belews Creek, Crooked Creek, Baker Branch, tributaries to the Dan River, and Big Beaver Island Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mayodan... Madison... Walnut Cove... Danbury... Sandy Ridge... Dillard... and Prestonville... - For additional information please go to http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precautionary Statements: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
